avalancheActivity.comment:
A lot of new snow above approximately 2000 m.
Avalanches can be released very easily and reach dangerously large size. This applies in particular above approximately 2000 m. From high-altitude starting zones the avalanches can reach the valleys and endanger transportation routes that are exposed.
At low and intermediate altitudes moist avalanches can penetrate even deep layers.
The conditions are very critical for backcountry touring.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A critical avalanche situation will be encountered over a wide area. The large quantity of fresh snow as well as the often large wind slabs can be released easily or naturally.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 100 to 150 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last three days above approximately 2000 m. A lot of new snow in the high Alpine regions.
The sleet gave rise to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

As a consequence of new snow and wind, sometimes large wind slabs formed.

avalancheActivity.comment:
New snow and wind slabs can be released easily and reach large size, especially at intermediate and high altitudes.
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2400 m.

The current avalanche situation calls for great caution and restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs require caution, especially at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 50 to 70 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last three days above approximately 2200 m. A lot of new snow in the high Alpine regions. Up to 2000 m rain has fallen in some regions.

As a consequence of new snow and wind, sometimes large wind slabs formed.

The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust, after a clear night especially at low and intermediate altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
New snow and wind slabs can be released easily and reach large size, especially at intermediate and high altitudes.
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2400 m.

The current avalanche situation calls for great caution and restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Gradual decrease in avalanche danger. New snow and wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 60 to 80 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last three days above approximately 2000 m.
The sleet gave rise to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
As a consequence of new snow and wind, sometimes large wind slabs formed in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.

avalancheActivity.comment:
A lot of new snow above approximately 2000 m.
Avalanches can be released very easily and reach dangerously large size. This applies in particular above approximately 2000 m. From high-altitude starting zones the avalanches can as before reach low altitudes.
Below approximately 2400 m moist and wet avalanches are possible. Moist avalanches can penetrate even deep layers.
The conditions are very dangerous for backcountry touring and snowshoe hiking.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The large quantity of fresh snow as well as the often large wind slabs can be released easily or naturally.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 70 to 90 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last three days above approximately 2000 m. A lot of new snow in the high Alpine regions.
The sleet gave rise to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
As a consequence of new snow and wind, sometimes large wind slabs formed in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2400 m.
New snow and wind slabs can be released and reach medium size, especially in high Alpine regions.

The current avalanche situation calls for caution.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Dry and moist avalanches require caution.

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 30 cm of snow fell in the last three days above approximately 2200 m. Up to 2100 m rain has fallen.

The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust, after a clear night especially at low and intermediate altitudes.
